pageContext.claim: “The new USMCA stops that [referring to the outsourcing of auto manufacturing jobs].”
pageContext.analysis: This is exaggerated. The USMCA includes wage requirements stipulating 40 percent to 45 percent of auto content be made by workers earning at least $16 per hour, as opposed to NAFTA, which had no wage requirement. Among other measures, the USMCA requires that 75 percent of vehicles be made of North American content, up from 62.5 percent under NAFTA.
